name: seamless attribute for iframes
description: The seamless attribute makes an iframe's contents actually part of a page, and adopts the styles from its hosting page. The attribute has been removed from both [the WHATWG](https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/331) and [the W3C](https://github.com/w3c/html/pull/325) HTML5 specifications.

notes.general: Chrome 20-26 had partial support behind a flag, though this was [later removed](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=229421).

byNum.1: Hides the border of seamless iframes and recognizes the 'seamless' DOM property, but does not provide actual support.
